question: [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-aggregator/src/delayed_field_extension.rs] [Function: snapshot()] [ID generation exploit] At line 217, generate_delayed_field_id is called with a width parameter - can attackers manipulate the width calculation to cause ID collisions between snapshots? (Critical)

Does line 210 catch this, or can nested snapshots cause issues? (Medium)

(High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-aggregator/src/delayed_field_extension.rs] [Function: snapshot()] [Zero delta snapshot] Lines 202-208 handle the None case by creating a zero delta snapshot - can this be exploited to create snapshots that don't reflect actual aggregator state from storage? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-aggregator/src/delayed_field_extension.rs] [Function: read_snapshot()] [Read consistency] Both functions use ReadPosition::AfterCurrentTxn - can parallel execution cause different validators to read different snapshot values leading to consensus failures?
